So I have a question I would like to see if you guys can answer. Or at least, a subject matter that might make an interesting video. I'm interested in knowing how medieval people explained natural phenomena, in particular, lightning. Since there was no theory of electricity until the 17th and 18th centuries, how did people explain lightning? In general though, a video about Medieval European Science would be interesting, since, while the catholic church wasn't exactly handing out STEM scholarships, there was still natural philosophy and there were secular explanations for everyday phenomena, I just can't find any good sources that explain in any detail about these beliefs. A video about that would be great, thanks.
